sen.j: 武田 元繁（たけだもとしげ、応仁元年（1467年） - 永正14年10月28日 (旧暦)（1517年11月11日））は日本の戦国時代の武将。
sen.e: Motoshige TAKEDA (1467-November 11, 1517) was busho (Japanese military commander) in Japan who lived during the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【戦国時代】に続く【（日本）】を削除しました。
sen.e: Motoshige TAKEDA (1467 - November 11, 1517) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: ハイフンの前後に１スペースずつ入れました。戦国時代→Sengoku period (period of warring states)[用語集を参照し、変更しました]武将→Japanese military commander[作業指示書一式の"Dos and Don'ts for the Kyoto Project"3項目目、Be careful not to "romanize" Japanese terms unnecessarily、に従い、変更しました。また、「日本の」が重複するので、"in Japan"は削除しました]
sen.e: Motoshige TAKEDA (1467 - November 11, 1517) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安芸武田氏当主。
sen.e: He was the family head of the Aki-Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【安芸】の前の【武田氏】を削除しました。
sen.e: He was the head of the Aki-Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: 当主→head[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: He was the head of the Aki-Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 武田元綱の嫡子。
sen.e: He was a legitimate child of Mototsuna TAKEDA.
He was a legitimate son of Mototsuna TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: "child"でも間違いではないのですが、より厳密にするため、"son"に変更しました。
sen.e: He was a legitimate son of Mototsuna TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安芸の佐東・山県・安南の分郡守護。
sen.e: He was bungun-shugo (a provincial constable of a specially given province in gun unit) of Sato, Yamagata, and Anan of Aki Province.
He was Bungunshugo (a provincial constable of a specially given province in gun unit) of Sato, Yamagata, and Anan Counties in Aki Province.
sen.cmt: 分郡守護→Bungunshugo (a provincial constable of a specially given province in gun unit)[対訳及び用語集の表記に従い、大文字・ハイフンなしの表記に変更しました]佐東・山県・安南→Sato, Yamagata and Anan Counties[いずれも郡の名称なので、"Counties"を追加しました]
sen.e: He was Bungunshugo (a provincial constable of a specially given province in gun unit) of Sato, Yamagata, and Anan Counties in Aki Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 別名元重。
sen.e: His name was also written as 元重 (in addition to 元繁).
Motoshige can be written as either '元繁' or '元重' in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、変更しました。
sen.e: Motoshige can be written as either '元繁' or '元重' in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子に武田光和。
sen.e: His child was Mitsukazu TAKEDA.
One of his children was Mitsukazu TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: 安芸武田氏の家系図を参照し、子どもが二人いたので、"one of his children"に変更しました。
sen.e: One of his children was Mitsukazu TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 正室は大内氏養女である飛鳥井家。
sen.e: His lawful wife, an adopted daughter of the Ouchi, was of the Asukai family.
His lawful wife was the adopted daughter of the Ouchi clan, who was from the Asukai family.
sen.cmt: 「大内氏の養女となった飛鳥井家出身の娘」と解釈し、変更しました。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the adopted daughter of the Ouchi clan, who was from the Asukai family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後室は尼子久幸の女。
sen.e: His second wife was a daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO.
His second wife was the daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO.
sen.cmt: 用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、"a"を"the"に変更しました。
sen.e: His second wife was the daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安芸武田氏は甲斐武田氏等と同族で、若狭武田氏の安芸分郡守護代として、安芸佐東銀山城を拠点とした。
sen.e: Aki-Takeda clan was of the same family as the Kai-Takeda clan, etc., and their foothold was Sato-Kanayama-jo Castle in Aki Province as bungun-shugo-dai (delegates of bungun-shugo) of the Wakasa-Takeda clan in Aki Province.

The Aki-Takeda clan was of the same family line as the Kai-Takeda clan and so on, and was based at Sato-Kanayama-jo Castle in Aki Province as Bungun Shugodai (deputy of Bungunshugo) of the Wakasa-Takeda clan in Aki Province.
sen.cmt: 等→and so on[用語リストの指示に従い、変更しました]
sen.e: The Aki-Takeda clan was of the same family line as the Kai-Takeda clan and so on, and was based at Sato-Kanayama-jo Castle in Aki Province as Bungun Shugodai (deputy of Bungunshugo) of the Wakasa-Takeda clan in Aki Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1493年、明応の政変が起き、管領細川政元が室町幕府征夷大将軍足利義稙を追放し、新将軍として足利義澄を擁立した。
sen.e: In 1493, Coup of Meio took place and Shogunal Deputy Masamoto HOSOKAWA expelled Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi shogunate, and recruited Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA as the new shogun.
In 1493, when the Coup of Meio took place, Shogunal Deputy Masamoto HOSOKAWA expelled Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi shogunate, and enthroned Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA as new shogun.
sen.cmt: 擁立する→enthrone[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: In 1493, when the Coup of Meio took place, Shogunal Deputy Masamoto HOSOKAWA expelled Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi shogunate, and enthroned Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA as new shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京を逐われた義材は、数年間の流浪の末に大内義興を頼って山口に下向した。
sen.e: Yoshiki (a name used by Yoshitane ASHIKAGA before he changed it to Yoshitane), who was expelled from the capital, turned to Yoshioki OUCHI and headed down to Yamaguchi after several years of wandering.
Yoshiki (former name of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA) who was expelled from Kyoto headed down to Yamaguchi to ask Yoshioki OUCHI for help after wandering for several years.
sen.cmt: 義材→Yoshiki (former name of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA)[簡潔にするため、説明の英訳を変更しました]数年間の流浪→wandering for several years[自然な英訳に変更しました]
sen.e: Yoshiki (former name of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA) who was expelled from Kyoto headed down to Yamaguchi to ask Yoshioki OUCHI for help after wandering for several years.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この政変の混乱に乗じて大内氏が武田領へ侵攻を開始した。
sen.e: Seizing this opportunity, the Ouchi clan began invading Takeda's territories.
Taking advantage of disorder by this Coup, the Ouchi clan began invading Takeda's territories.
sen.cmt: 「政変の混乱」の訳が抜けていましたので、補いました。
sen.e: Taking advantage of disorder by this Coup, the Ouchi clan began invading Takeda's territories.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 家臣の温科国親の離反など武田家中は大混乱となった。
sen.e: Due to estrangement by Kunichika NUKUSHINA and other causes, the Takeda family was in utter turmoil; although Kunichika's rebellion was quelled at the hands of Yoshinao KUMAGAI, Motoshige was forced to yield allegiance to the Ouchi clan.
Due to estrangement by a vassal, Kunichika NUKUSHINA, and other causes, the Takeda family fell into utter turmoil.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to estrangement by a vassal, Kunichika NUKUSHINA, and other causes, the Takeda family fell into utter turmoil.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 熊谷膳直の働きで国親の反乱は鎮圧されたものの、元繁は大内氏に服属を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: Although the Kunichika's rebellion was suppressed by activities of Yoshinao KUMAGAI, Motoshige was forced to yield allegiance to the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処鎮圧された→be suppressed[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: Although the Kunichika's rebellion was suppressed by activities of Yoshinao KUMAGAI, Motoshige was forced to yield allegiance to the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1508年、大内義興は足利義材を奉じて上洛軍を起こし、武田元繁もこれに従い上洛した。
sen.e: In 1508, Yoshioki OUCHI launched Joraku (advancing to the capital) army under Yoshiki ASHIKAGA, and Motoshige TAKEDA, obeying the order, went to Kyoto as well.
In 1508, Yoshioki OUCHI obeying Yoshiki ASHIKAGA raised the Joraku (going to Kyoto) army, and Motoshige TAKEDA also followed the army and went to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 奉じる→obey[用語集を参照し、変更しました]上洛軍を起こす→raise the Joraku (going to Kyoto) army[「軍を起こす」は、用語集の「挙兵」を参考にしました]
sen.e: In 1508, Yoshioki OUCHI obeying Yoshiki ASHIKAGA raised the Joraku (going to Kyoto) army, and Motoshige TAKEDA also followed the army and went to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方、在京していた若狭武田氏当主武田元信は、足利義澄との密接な関係を維持した。
sen.e: On the other hand, Motonobu TAKEDA, the family head of the Wakasa-Takeda clan, who was in Kyoto, maintained a close relationship with Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【若狭武田氏】の前の【武田氏】を削除しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Motonobu TAKEDA, the family head of the Wakasa-Takeda clan, who was in Kyoto, maintained a close relationship with Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On the other hand, Motonobu TAKEDA, the family head of the Wakasa-Takeda clan, who was in Kyoto, maintained a close relationship with Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これ以後、安芸武田氏は若狭武田氏から完全に独立することとなった。
sen.e: Since then, the Aki-Takeda clan became completely independent from the Wakasa-Takeda clan.
After that, the Aki-Takeda clan became independent of the Wakasa-Takeda clan completely.
sen.cmt: ～から独立する→independent of ～[前置詞を訂正しました]
sen.e: After that, the Aki-Takeda clan became independent of the Wakasa-Takeda clan completely.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 上洛した大内義興は、足利義材改め足利義稙を将軍職に復帰させると、管領代として京都に留まり、元繁もこれに従い駐留を続けることになった。
sen.e: Yoshioki OUCHI, who had gone to the capital, had Yoshiki ASHIKAGA, who changed his name to Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, return to the position of shogun; then Yoshioki remained in Kyoto as kanrei-dai (representative of a shogunal deputy), and Motoshige likewise remained in Kyoto.

When Yoshioki OUCHI, who went to Kyoto, had Yoshitane ASHIKAGA renamed from Yoshiki ASHIKAGA, return to the position of shogun, Yoshioki remained in Kyoto as Kanrei-dai (representative of a shogunal deputy), and Motoshige following him also remained in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 管領代→Kanrei-dai (representative of a shogunal deputy)[用語集の表記に従い、変更しました]～に従い→following[訳が抜けていたので、補いました]
sen.e: When Yoshioki OUCHI, who went to Kyoto, had Yoshitane ASHIKAGA renamed from Yoshiki ASHIKAGA, return to the position of shogun, Yoshioki remained in Kyoto as Kanrei-dai (representative of a shogunal deputy), and Motoshige following him also remained in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大内氏の当主と主力が不在の安芸国では、厳島神主家で後継者を巡って内訌が発生したため、大内義興は鎮圧のため元繁を帰国させた。
sen.e: In Aki Province where the family head of the Ouchi clan and the main power were absent, internal strife was taking place over the successor of the family of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine, and Yoshioki OUCHI sent Motoshige home to suppress the situation.

By reason that internal strife took place over the successor of the family of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine priest in Aki Province where the head of the Ouchi clan and the main power were absent, Yoshioki OUCHI had Motoshige return to Aki Province to suppress the strife.
sen.cmt: 厳島神主家→the family of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine priest[用語集を参照し、"priest"を追加しました]鎮圧のため→to suppress the strife[「内訌を鎮圧するため」なので、"the strife" に変更しました]帰国させる→have someone return to Aki Province[「家」に帰すのではなく、「自分の国（安芸国）に帰す」ので、Aki Provinceに変更しました]
sen.e: By reason that internal strife took place over the successor of the family of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine priest in Aki Province where the head of the Ouchi clan and the main power were absent, Yoshioki OUCHI had Motoshige return to Aki Province to suppress the strife.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元繁はこれを好機と見て、独立と勢力拡大を画策した。
sen.e: Motoshige took it as an opportunity to plan independence and expansion of power.
Motoshige who turned it into an opportunity planned to become independent and expand his power.
sen.cmt: 「～するのに好機である」ではなく、「実際に画策した」ので、変更しました。
sen.e: Motoshige who turned it into an opportunity planned to become independent and expand his power.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大内義興の養女である妻を離縁し、尼子経久の弟尼子久幸の娘を妻とすると、出雲国尼子氏の支援を背景に大内氏を離反した。
sen.e: He divorced his wife who was an adopted daughter of Yoshioki OUCHI and took as his wife a daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO, a younger brother of Tsunehisa AMAGO, and with the support of the Amago clan of Izumo Province, seceded from the Ouchi clan.

When he divorced his wife who was the adopted daughter of Yoshioki OUCHI, and remarried the daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO, a younger brother of Tsunehisa AMAGO, Motoshige defected from the Ouchi clan with the support of the Amago clan of Izumo Province as a backdrop.
sen.cmt: 尼子久幸の娘を妻にする→remarry the daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO[再婚となるので、"remarry"としました]～を背景に→with ～ as a backdrop[「背景」の訳が抜けていたので、補いました]
sen.e: When he divorced his wife who was the adopted daughter of Yoshioki OUCHI, and remarried the daughter of Hisayuki AMAGO, a younger brother of Tsunehisa AMAGO, Motoshige defected from the Ouchi clan with the support of the Amago clan of Izumo Province as a backdrop.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元繁は大内側の己斐城を攻撃するなど、安芸国内での勢力拡大を図った。
sen.e: Motoshige expanded his power in Aki Province by, for example, attacking the Koi-jo Castle of the Ouchi side.
Motoshige expanded his power in Aki Province through attack against Koi-jo Castle on the Ouchi side, and so on.
sen.cmt: 大内側→on the Ouchi side[「～に味方している」は、"on the side"となるので、前置詞を変更しました]など→and so on[用語リストの指示に従い、変更しました。"and so on"に変更するため、"by attacking"を"through attack against"に変更しました]
sen.e: Motoshige expanded his power in Aki Province through attack against Koi-jo Castle on the Ouchi side, and so on.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1516年毛利家当主毛利興元が病死し、幼少の毛利幸松丸が跡を継ぐと、その動揺に乗じ大内方の毛利・吉川に占領されていた有田城を奪還するために行動を開始。
sen.e: When in 1516, Okimoto MORI, the family head of the Mori family, died of illness and young Komatsumaru MORI succeeded, Motoshige took advantage of the turmoil and began taking actions to recapture the Arita-jo Castle which had been occupied by Mori and Yoshikawa of the Ouchi side.

When Okimoto MORI, the head of the Mori family, died of illness and young Komatsumaru MORI succeeded to Okimoto's position in 1516, Motoshige who took advantage of disturbance began actions to recapture Arita-jo Castle which had been occupied by Mori and Yoshikawa on the Ouchi side.
sen.cmt: 跡を継ぐ→succeeded to the family head[「当主を継ぐ」の意味なので、"the family head"を追記しました]大内方→on the Ouchi side[「～に味方している」は、"on the side"となるので、前置詞を変更しました]
sen.e: When Okimoto MORI, the head of the Mori family, died of illness and young Komatsumaru MORI succeeded to Okimoto's position in 1516, Motoshige who took advantage of disturbance began actions to recapture Arita-jo Castle which had been occupied by Mori and Yoshikawa on the Ouchi side.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1517年、有田城攻略の軍を起こした。
sen.e: In 1517, he launched an army to capture the Arita-jo Castle.
In 1517, he raised an army to capture the Arita-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 軍を起こす→raise an army[用語集の「挙兵」を参考に、変更しました]
sen.e: In 1517, he raised an army to capture the Arita-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元繁は熊谷元直に兵を与えて救援に来る毛利・吉川軍の迎撃に当たらせ、自分は主力を率いて有田城を攻撃した。
sen.e: Motoshige equipped Motonao KUMAGAI with warriors to ambush the Mori and Yoshikawa armies which were coming for rescue, and he led the main force to attack the Arita-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【熊谷元直】に続く【（戦国時代）】を削除しました。
sen.e: Motoshige provided Motonao KUMAGAI with soldiers and entrusted him with interception of Mori and Yoshikawa armies coming to the rescue, and he himself led the main force and attacked Arita-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 与える→provide[一般的な単語に変更しました]兵→soldiers[用語集を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: Motoshige provided Motonao KUMAGAI with soldiers and entrusted him with interception of Mori and Yoshikawa armies coming to the rescue, and he himself led the main force and attacked Arita-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 熊谷元直軍は毛利・吉川連合軍と戦端を開くも、毛利氏当主の後見役であった毛利元就の用兵により壊滅し、元直は討死した。
sen.e: The army of Motonao KUMAGAI opened war with the Mori and Yoshikawa allied forces; under the tactics of Motonari MORI, the conservator of the family head of the Mori clan, Motonao died on the battlefield.

Although the army of Motonao KUMAGAI opened war with the Mori and Yoshikawa allied forces, the army was destroyed by the tactics of Motonari MORI who was the conservator of the head of the Mori clan, and Motonao died on the battlefield.
sen.cmt: "Although"で始めることにより、一文（セミコロンでつなげない文）に変更しました。壊滅する→be destroyed[訳が抜けていたので、補いました]
sen.e: Although the army of Motonao KUMAGAI opened war with the Mori and Yoshikawa allied forces, the army was destroyed by the tactics of Motonari MORI who was the conservator of the head of the Mori clan, and Motonao died on the battlefield.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 敗戦の報に激昂した元繁は、自ら軍を率いて毛利・吉川連合軍を攻撃した。
sen.e: Motoshige, enraged at the report of defeat, personally led an army to attack the Mori and Yoshikawa allied forces; although he prevailed in the battle, he was shot by a stray arrow while crossing the Matauchi-gawa River and fell off his horse, and his head was decapitated.
Motoshige outraged by the report of defeat led an army and attacked the Mori and Yoshikawa allied forces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（原文を分けた方が自然な英語表現となるので、分割しました）
sen.e: Motoshige outraged by the report of defeat led an army and attacked the Mori and Yoshikawa allied forces.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 優勢に戦を進めていたが、又打川を渡る際に流れ矢に射抜かれ落馬、首を取られた。
sen.e: Although he prevailed in the battle, Motoshige was shot by a stray arrow while crossing the Matauchi-gawa River and fell from his horse, and his head was cut off and taken away.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処"depictated"の場合は、"he"が主語となるので、「首を取られた」の英訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Although he prevailed in the battle, Motoshige was shot by a stray arrow while crossing the Matauchi-gawa River and fell from his horse, and his head was cut off and taken away.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （有田中井手の戦い）。
sen.e: (Battle at Arita-Nakaide)
(the Battle of Arita-Nakaide)
sen.cmt: 用語集を参照し、変更しました。
sen.e: (the Battle of Arita-Nakaide)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元繁の討死により、武田家は光和が相続するが、この戦いを期に安芸武田氏は徐々に衰退し、数代後に強大化した毛利氏により滅亡させられることになる。
sen.e: With the death of Motoshige on the battlefield, Mitsukazu succeeded the Takeda family; however, after this battle the Aki-Takeda clan gradually weakened and was eventually ruined by the Mori clan which had gained power several generations later.

Although Mitsukazu succeeded to the headship of the Takeda family due to Motoshige's death on the battlefield, the Aki-Takeda clan gradually weakened in the wake of this Battle, and was eventually defeated several generations later by the Mori clan which became more powerful.
sen.cmt: この戦い→this Battle[有田中井手の戦いを指しているので、大文字で表記しました]～を期に→in the wake of ～[after より、「～を期に」が持つ意味に近いと判断し、変更しました]
sen.e: Although Mitsukazu succeeded to the headship of the Takeda family due to Motoshige's death on the battlefield, the Aki-Takeda clan gradually weakened in the wake of this Battle, and was eventually defeated several generations later by the Mori clan which became more powerful.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
